parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma1

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1 </name>=<value> Multiplayer

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Sets vehicle as respawnable in MP game. The vehicle will be spawned at the locality and coordinates it was prior to destruction. If respawn type is set to base respawn (type 3) and vehicle respawn marker is provided (respawn_vehicle_XXXSIDEXXX), vehicle will spawn on the marker. <br><br>

<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Informative </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> Command has to be executed where vehicle is [[local]] </value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> vehicle '''respawnVehicle''' [delay, count]

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> vehicle: [[Object]]
</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> [delay, count]: [[Array]]
</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> delay: [[Number]] - Delay in seconds between respawns. (-1 to use ''respawnDelay'' from [[description.ext]])
</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> count: [[Number]] (Optional) - How many times to respawn vehicle in total. (0 - unlimited respawns)

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>car [[respawnVehicle]] [5, 3];</code>

'car' will respawn at the predefined marker for the [[side]] after 5 seconds. The unit will respawn 3 times.

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>car [[respawnVehicle]] [30];</code>

'car' will respawn at the predefined marker for the [[side]] after 30 seconds. The unit will respawn an unlimited number of times.

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[playerRespawnTime]], [[setPlayerRespawnTime]]
</value></part></template>


<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma2</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>tkoh</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>

<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>ofpe</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma1</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on May 28, 2007 - 16:38 (CEST)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Sy|Sy]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
For this command to work (in MP) you need the appropriate markers in the mission.
The markers are...
<ext><name>pre</name><attr/><inner>respawn_vehicle_west
respawn_vehicle_east
respawn_vehicle_guerilla
respawn_vehicle_civilian
</inner><close></pre></close></ext>

Also, by default it will use respawnDelay from the description.ext as mentioned unless you specify
<ext><name>pre</name><attr/><inner>respawnVehicleDelay = x;</inner><close></pre></close></ext>
Where x is delay in seconds.

----

In Multiplayer the respawned vehicle remains local to the client who was the last driver of the vehicle or the client who was the leader of the last AI driver of the vehicle.
If the vehicle has yet to be driven or the AI driver is local to the Server then the respawned vehicle will be local to the Server.
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
